lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Lintz.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Lintz.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* Represents a user command with its associated arguments.
* Constructs a Command with the given command and arguments.
* @param arguments The arguments associated with the command.
* Executes the command based on its type.

* @param ui       The Ui for displaying messages.
* @param storage  The Storage for storing and saving tasks.
* @throws IllegalInputException   If the command is invalid.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If the command arguments are invalid.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws IllegalInputException, IndexOutOfBoundsException {

* Represents a Deadline task, which is a type of Task with an explicit deadline.
* Constructs a Deadline task with the given description and deadline.
* @param description The description of the Deadline task.
* @param by          The deadline of the task.
* Returns the string representation of the Deadline task.
* @return The string representation of the Deadline task.
* Represents an Event task, which is a type of Task with an explicit start and end time.
* Constructs an Event task with the given description, start time, and end time.
* @param description The description of the Event task.
* @param from        The start time of the event.
* @param to          The end time of the event.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {

* The main class for my Lintz chatbot application.
* Initializes the chatbot Lintz, takes in user input, interpret the command, and executes.
* Initializes the user interface, storage, and task list.
* Starts the chatbot and interact with user input continuously until the user exits.
command.execute(taskList, ui, storage); // Execute the command
ui.displayError("Apologies Sir/Ma'am, might I trouble you to input your command again for clarification? Thank you Sir/Ma'am ;-D");
ui.displayError("Hi Sir/Ma'am, I've captured incomplete command, please be so kind to elaborate ;-)");
* The entry point of my Lintz chatbot application.
* Represents a custom exception for my Lintz chatbot.
* Constructs a LintzException with the given error message.
* Parses and interpret user input and task strings into commands and tasks to be executed.
* Parses a task string into a Task object.
* @param taskString The string representation of the task.
* Parses a user input string into a Command object.
* Handles loading and saving tasks to a file.
* Ensures that the file and its parent directory exist. If not, create them.
* Saves the list of tasks to the file.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to save.
* Loads the list of tasks from the file.
* @return The list of tasks loaded from the file.
* Represents a task with a description and a completion status.
* Constructs a Task with the given description.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns the status icon of the task.
* @return "X" if the task is done, " " otherwise.
* Returns the string representation of the task.
* @return The string representation of the task.
* Checks if the task is done.
* @return True if the task is done, false otherwise.
* Manages the list of tasks, including add, delete, mark and unmark tasks.
* Constructs a TaskList with an existing list of tasks.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to initialize the TaskList with.
* Adds a task to the tasks list.
* Deletes a task from the tasks list by its index.
* @param index The index of the task to delete.
* Marks a task as done by its index.
* @param index The index of the task to mark as done.
* Marks a task as undone by its index.
* @param index The index of the task to mark as undone.
* Returns the number of tasks in the tasks list.
* Finds tasks that contain the given keyword in their description.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for.
* @return A list of tasks that match the keyword.
* Represents a Todo Task, which is a type of Task with no explicit deadline or event time.
* Constructs a Todo task with the given description.
* @param description The description of the Todo task.
* Returns the string representation of the Todo task.
* @return The string representation of the Todo task.
* Represents the different types of tasks that can be created.
* Interact with all user interactions, including displaying messages and reading input.
* Constructs a Ui instance and initializes the scanner for taking in user input.
* Displays the greeting message and logo when the chatbot starts.
System.out.println("\t " + "As always, pleasure to serve you Sir/Ma'am!\n");
* Reads a command from the user.
* @return The user's input as a string.
* Displays confirmation message when a task is successfully added to the task list.
* @param task      The task that was added.
* @param taskCount The total number of tasks after adding the new task.
public void displayTaskAdded(Task task, int taskCount) {
System.out.println("\t " + "Copy Sir/Ma'am, I've added this task: ");
System.out.println("\t " + "You have now " + taskCount + " tasks Sir/Ma'am." + "\n");
* Displays confirmation message when a task is successfully deleted from the task list.
* @param task      The task that was deleted.
* @param taskCount The total number of tasks after deleting the task.
public void displayTaskDeleted(Task task, int taskCount) {
System.out.println("\t " + "Copy Sir/Ma'am, I've deleted this task: ");
System.out.println("\t " + "You have now " + taskCount + " tasks Sir/Ma'am." + "\n");
* Displays the list of tasks in the tasks list.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to display.
System.out.println("\t " + "Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Displays a message with the "[X]" representing "marked" when a task is marked as done.
* @param task The task that was marked as done.
System.out.println("\tCongratulations Sir/Ma'am on completing this task:");
* Displays a message with the "[ ]" representing "unmarked" when a task is marked as undone.
* @param task The task that was marked as undone.
System.out.println("\tNo worries Sir/Ma'am, we've got ample of time to complete this task:");
* Displays an error message to the user.

System.out.println("\t Please input the correct input template shown:\n" +
* Displays a message when there are no tasks in the task list.
System.out.println("\t " + "Hi Sir/Ma'am, rest assured, you have currently no tasks at all");
* Displays the list of tasks that match the given keyword.
* @param matchingTasks The list of tasks that match the keyword.
System.out.println("\t " + "No tasks found matching your search, Sir/Ma'am.");
System.out.println("\t " + "Here are the matching tasks in your list, Sir/Ma'am:");
* Displays the exit message when the user wishes to leave the application.
System.out.println("\t " + "See you Sir/Ma'am! I will be on standby at all times!");
